instruction: [INST] Analyze this file to learn MacBook motherboard repair. The 'definitions' section explains key technical terms. The 'threads' section contains real-world repair discussions. Use both sections to understand and learn how to troubleshoot MacBook issues. Posts from username 'larossmann' , 'dukefawks' , and '2informaticos' are posts from trusted experts.[/INST]

definitions.820-00165: What is 820-00165? a LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER.
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA: What is SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA? SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SDA is the data line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED. If this line’s resistance to ground is too low because of a defective component, battery will not be recognized with an X on the icon and PPBUS_G3H voltage will be lower than it is on a good system..
definitions.SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL: What is SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL? SMBUS_SMC_5_G3_SCL is the clock line of an I2C data line between the battery charging chip that creates PPBUS_G3H, the system management controller(SMC), the battery, and the battery indicator LED. If this line’s resistance to ground is too low because of a defective component, battery will not be recognized with an X on the icon and PPBUS_G3H voltage will be lower than it is on a good system..
definitions.U7100: What is U7100? U7100 refers to the ISL6259 or ISL9239 charging IC on Macbooks from 2013 to the present.
definitions.PPBUS_G3H: What is PPBUS_G3H? Main system power rail that charges the battery, or is power from the battery, that everything else is powered from. .

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 - Won't Charge
threads.message:
The computer works fine without the battery.
The thing is: I can't charge, bc when i put the battery back the computer don't turn on and i don't get green light.
Already check two different battery, so i'm sure thats not the problem.

Were i can start troubleshooting for give you guys idea what could be wrong with this board?

threads.message: Could be a bad <TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR>....  Measure from source to drain in diode mode could be shorted....

threads.message: Diode mode: Pin 3 S and 5 D = 0.468

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 - Won't Charge
threads.message:
<CHIP>U7100</CHIP>
16 - 8.40 to 1v (after 3 seconds in loop)

<CAPACITOR>C7126</CAPACITOR> - The same
<TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR> - Pin 4 the same

If the the voltage drop from the <CHIP>U7100</CHIP> pin 16 (<SIGNAL>CHARGE_BGATE</SIGNAL>) all the line will drop too. I think the problem is <CHIP>U7100</CHIP>
I'm right, [USER="36"]aprendiz[/USER] [USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER] ?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 - Won't Charge
threads.message: You are hopeless, you are measuring diode mode and giving me a value in MΩ. I just give up.

[USER="2"]dukefawks[/USER] Can u explain to me, why the voltage drop for 1v and then back to the normal state?
Thats is because the battery is not plugged?

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 - Won't Charge
<LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 - Won't Charge
threads.message: The only time anything remotely like this occurred to me was when a <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> high side mosfet was shorted and making <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> 16v. Seeing as your <SIGNAL>PPBUS_G3H</SIGNAL> is 8.4v, that is not the case here, so I have no idea either.

threads.title: <LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>820-00165</LOGIC BOARD PART NUMBER>-02 - Won't Charge
threads.message:
[USER="1"]larossmann[/USER] I just get new measurements with battery plugged:

<TRANSISTOR>Q7155</TRANSISTOR>:
Pin 3-2-1: 8.62v
Pin 4: 1.13V
Pin 5: 8.61v

Right now the voltage dont drop.
Also, i don't get green light.

Do you think could be bad SMC?
